page.title: 03Pilkington Bros.of St.Helens
page.content: Some say that St.Helens is Pilkingtons as they provide so much of the work, both directly and indirectly,in the town.Today in St.Helens they employ 17,000 people involved in making flat glass,opthalmic glass,safety glass and glass fibres. St.Helens is not only Pilkingtons manufacturing 'home base', but the headquarters for its worldwide operations--some 100 subsiduries making a total workforce of 44,000 with sales in 1984 of Â£1.2 billion! The workers and their families are well provided for by 'Pilks' with sports clubs and grounds,social clubs and even clubs for their retired workers.However in 1985 with increased automation and computerisation,and it being cheaper to make glass elsewhere, the numbers employed are falling.
